question: What two-word type of model did Manash Pratim Kashyap's and PS Fader's studies in customer retention studies published during 2018-2019 have in common (no punctuation)?

trajectory.question: What two-word type of model did Manash Pratim Kashyap's and PS Fader's studies in customer retention studies published during 2018-2019 have in common (no punctuation)?

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to quickly find the specific 2018-2019 customer retention studies by Manash Pratim Kashyap and PS Fader and identify the shared model type.

args.query: Manash Pratim Kashyap customer retention 2018 2019 model type

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. a simple model for analyzing the customer retention comparing rural ...
   URL: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332297417_A_SIMPLE_MODEL_FOR_ANALYZING_THE_CUSTOMER_RETENTION_COMPARING_RURAL_AND_URBAN_STORE
   Site: researchgate.net
   Date: Aug 6, 2025
   Summary: PDF | On Mar 31, 2019, ManashPratim Kashyap published A SIMPLE MODEL FOR ANALYZING THE CUSTOMER RETENTION COMPARING RURAL AND URBAN STORE.

2. A Simple Model For Analyzing The Customer Retention Comparing ...
   URL: https://www.journalijar.com/article/26843/a-simple-model-for-analyzing-the-customer-retention-comparing-rural-and-urban-store/
   Site: journalijar.com
   Date: Mar 1, 2019
   Summary: The main goal of this paper is to predict future purchase patterns for rural and urban customer that can be described by the structural characteristics.

3. A Simple Model for Analyzing the Customer Retention Comparing ...
   URL: https://www.academia.edu/89361498/A_Simple_Model_for_Analyzing_the_Customer_Retention_Comparing_Rural_and_Urban_Store
   Site: academia.edu
   Summary: The study analyzes customer retention using a discrete time beta geometric model on 390 households. Retention rates show 75% for rural customers and 55.37% for ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to verify which model type PS Fader used in a 2018-2019 customer retention study and see if it matches Kashyap’s, likely beta geometric.

args.query: PS Fader 2018 customer retention beta geometric 2019 BG model

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. [PDF] “How to Project Customer Retention” Revisited - LBS Research Online
   URL: https://lbsresearch.london.edu/954/1/BdW_JIM_2018-01-10.pdf
   Site: lbsresearch.london.edu
   Summary: Fader and Hardie (2007), hereafter FH, presented the beta-geometric (BG) distribution as a simple probability model for projecting customer retention. This ...

2. 'How to Project Customer Retention' Revisited: The Role of Duration ...
   URL: https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3100346
   Site: papers.ssrn.com
   Date: Jan 18, 2018
   Summary: Cohort-level retention rates typically increase over time, and the beta-geometric (BG) distribution has proven to be a robust model for ...

3. How to Project Customer Retention | Request PDF - ResearchGate
   URL: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/264466889_How_to_Project_Customer_Retention
   Site: researchgate.net
   Date: Aug 6, 2025
   Summary: The shifted-beta-geometric (sBG) distribution, introduced by Fader and Hardie [10] , is a model designed to predict customer retention rates ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
Both studies reference the beta-geometric model for customer retention: Kashyap’s 2019 paper uses a discrete time beta geometric model, and Fader’s 2018 “How to Project Customer Retention” revisited paper discusses the beta-geometric distribution.

FINAL ANSWER: beta geometric
